comments.html: I think BGP is being used for people multihoming their sites onto the Internet, hence the explosion in the size of the Internet Routing table and /24 advertisements.
comments.name: Unknown

comments.html: BGP usage has taken off in the Enterprise due to the migration to MPLS from frame/ATM.  In my experience, many companies have taken paths to avoid BGP, only to find later that it provides the best solution in an MPLS-based network, and especially in a dual-carrier MPLS environment.
comments.name: Jeremy Filliben
